item.title: Aries-Leigh add a quote by S.E. Hinton
item.description: "I lie to myself all the time. But I never believe me." -- S.E. Hinton

item.title: Aries-Leigh add a quote by S.E. Hinton
item.description: "Stay gold, Ponyboy, stay gold." -- S.E. Hinton

item.title: Aries-Leigh add a quote by S.E. Hinton
item.description: "If you have two friends in your lifetime, you're lucky. If you have one <I>good</i> friend, you're more than lucky." -- S.E. Hinton

item.title: Aries-Leigh add a quote by S.E. Hinton
item.description: "It's okay. We aren't in the same class. Just don't forget that some of us watch the sunset too." -- S.E. Hinton

item.title: Aries-Leigh add a quote by S.E. Hinton
item.description: "nothing can wear you out like caring about people" -- S.E. Hinton

item.title: Aries-Leigh add a quote by S.E. Hinton
item.description: "When I stepped out into the bright sunlight, from the darkness of the movie house, I had only two things on my mind: Paul Newman and a ride home..." -- S.E. Hinton

item.title: Aries-Leigh add a quote by S.E. Hinton
item.description:
"Nothing Stay Forever" "Nature’s first green is gold, "Her hardest hue to hold. "Her early leaf’s a flower; "But only so an hour. "Then leaf subsides to leaf. "So Eden sank to grief, "So dawn goes down today. "Nothing gold can stay.
-- Robert Frost" -- S.E. Hinton

item.title: Aries-Leigh add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "Evil is always possible. And goodness is eternally difficult." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Aries-Leigh add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "The prince is never going to come. Everyone knows that; and maybe sleeping beauty's dead." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Aries-Leigh add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "The world changes, we do not, therein lies the irony that kills us." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Aries-Leigh add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "Come on, say it again. I'm a perfect devil. Tell me how bad I am. It makes me feel so good!" -- Anne Rice

item.title: Aries-Leigh add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "Goddamn it, do it yourself. You’re five hundred years old and you can’t use a telephone? Read the directions. What are you, an immortal idiot?" -- Anne Rice

item.title: Aries-Leigh add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "I can’t help being a gorgeous fiend. It’s just the card I drew." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Aries-Leigh add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "To write something you have to risk making a fool of yourself." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Aries-Leigh add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "I have lived lies. I have done it again and again. I live lies because I cannot endure the weakness of anger, and I cannot admit the irrationality of love.-Marius" -- Anne Rice

item.title: Aries-Leigh add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "It's an awful truth that suffering can deepen us, give a greater lustre to our colours, a richer resonance to our words." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Aries-Leigh add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "I'm Gentleman Death in silk and lace, come to put out the candles. The canker in the heart of the rose." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Aries-Leigh add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "It was as if when I looked into his eyes I was standing alone on the edge of the world...on a windswept ocean beach. There was nothing but the soft roar of the waves." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Aries-Leigh add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "The truth is, laughter always sounds more perfect than weeping. Laughter flows in a violent riff and is effortlessly melodic. Weeping is often fought, choked, half strangled, or surrendered to with humiliation." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Aries-Leigh add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "And what constitutes evil, real evil, is the taking of a single human life. Whether a man would die tomorrow or the day after or eventually... it doesn't matter. Because if God does not exist, then life... every second of it... Is all we have." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Aries-Leigh add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "In the spring of 1988, I returned to New Orleans, and as soon as I smelled the air, I knew I was home. It was rich, almost sweet, like the scent of jasmine and roses around our old courtyard. I walked the streets, savoring that long lost perfume." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Aries-Leigh add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "If I haven't put that on a T-shirt, I'm going to. Actually, I really don't want to write anything that can't be put on a T-shirt. Actually I'd like to write only on T-shirts. Actually, I'd like to write whole novels on T-shirts. So you guys could say, 'I'm wearing chapter 8 of Lestat's new book, that's my favorite; oh I see you're wearing chapter 6-" -- Anne Rice

item.title: Aries-Leigh add a quote by Marcel Duchamp
item.description: "All this twaddle, the existence of God, atheism, determinism, liberation, societies, death, etc., are pieces of a chess game called language, and they are amusing only if one does not preoccupy oneself with 'winning or losing this game of chess." -- Marcel Duchamp

item.title: Aries-Leigh add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "Thus, though I dislike to differ with such a great man, [author:Voltaire|5754446] was simply ludicrous when he said that if god did not exist it would be necessary to invent him. The human invention of god is the problem to begin with." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Aries-Leigh add a quote by Richard Pryor
item.description: "The reason people use a crucifix against vampires is because vampires are allergic to bullshit." -- Richard Pryor

item.title: Aries-Leigh add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Aries-Leigh add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Sometimes you climb out of bed in the morning and you think, I'm not going to make it, but you laugh inside — remembering all the times you've felt that way." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Aries-Leigh add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "That's the problem with drinking, I thought, as I poured myself a drink. If something bad happens you drink in an attempt to forget; if something good happens you drink in order to celebrate; and if nothing happens you drink to make something happen." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Aries-Leigh add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Real loneliness is not necessarily limited to when you are alone." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Aries-Leigh add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "I've never been lonely. I've been in a room -- I've felt suicidal. I've been depressed. I've felt awful -- awful beyond all -- but I never felt that one other person could enter that room and cure what was bothering me...or that any number of people could enter that room. In other words, loneliness is something I've never been bothered with because I've always had this terrible itch for solitude. It's being at a party, or at a stadium full of people cheering for something, that I might feel loneliness. I'll quote Ibsen, "The strongest men are the most alone." I've never thought, "Well, some beautiful blonde will come in here and give me a fuck-job, rub my balls, and I'll feel good." No, that won't help. You know the typical crowd, "Wow, it's Friday night, what are you going to do? Just sit there?" Well, yeah. Because there's nothing out there. It's stupidity. Stupid people mingling with stupid people. Let them stupidify themselves. I've never been bothered with the need to rush out into the night. I hid in bars, because I didn't want to hide in factories. That's all. Sorry for all the millions, but I've never been lonely. I like myself. I'm the best form of entertainment I have. Let's drink more wine!" -- Charles Bukowski
